intro: Haloragis aculeolata, commonly known as the spiny buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features small, yellow flowers clustered in umbels, and its leaves are usually alternate and lance-shaped. It has a robust root system that helps it survive in saline and arid conditions. Haloragis aculeolata is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
